Oliver Chang

Runner, Math/CS Major, and baseball nerd - but not necessarily in that order.

I am interested if genetic algorithms can accurately estimate the conditional expectation of a random variable. In other words, I find the crossroad between statistics and computer science fascinating. I like using R and Python for statistical analysis and Java for software engineering.

I am currently a 3rd-year at Pomona college, studying computer science and math. Outside of school, I run cross country and track & field, work as a math TA, and watch Dodgers baseball.

Feel free to checkout my resume and my transcript.
